content: Yes, that's correct. Solid-state drives (SSD) are faster than traditional hard drives, which makes them great for multitasking and overall system performance. As for the Dell Inspiron 14 5000, it does come with a solid-state drive (SSD) option. They have both storage options available, either 256GB or 512GB PCIe NVMe SSD, which is great for fast boot-up and load times for applications. If you plan on storing a lot of files, you may want to consider the 512GB option or connecting an external hard drive for additional storage.
